instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
threads.message:
Hey guys,

no liquid damage. Mac said adios connecting a charger...

5.2V, 0.02A - jumping to 0.2A and back to 0.02.

L6640 got blown, removed, still a short somewhere.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.3V unstable - jumping to 10 and back to 12

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> 0V


where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
threads.message: Remove <CAPACITOR>C6640</CAPACITOR>, disconnect J6640 and test again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
threads.message: remove the connector from the board? J6640?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
threads.message:
removed the logicboard, only charger connected...

same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
threads.message:
Exact resistace to ground at <SIGNAL>1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> (ohm scale)?
Compare with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
threads.message:
heres a photo. theres almost nothing left where i can solder to. short maybe there? how i solve it?


[ATTACH type="full"]60855[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - 5.2V 0.02A
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> appears on many places.
Use a proper point to inject voltage.
